items.title: Ultramassive Black Holes and the Three $M$-$\sigma$ Relations
items.summary: arXiv:2602.13382v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: I consider recent observations of ultramassive black holes. These appear to confirm theoretical predictions that the relation between central black hole mass $M$ and spheroid velocity dispersion $\sigma$ has the same form $M \propto…

items.title: CMB Spectral Distortions from Resonant Conversions in Atomic Dark Sectors
items.summary: arXiv:2602.13384v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Dark sectors consisting of atomic constituents (electrons, protons, and photons) offer a well-motivated extension to the Standard Model while providing multiple avenues for phenomenological study. In this work, we explore the impact…

items.title: Modeling Globular Cluster Stellar Streams with a Basis-Expansion N-body Code
items.summary: arXiv:2602.13385v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Globular cluster stellar streams probe galaxy-formation processes and can potentially reveal the distribution of dark matter in galaxies. In many theoretical studies, streams are modeled with particle-spray or direct N-body codes. B…

items.title: Dyad: a binary-star dynamics and statistics library for Python
items.summary: arXiv:2602.13388v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Dyad is a Python library for studying the dynamics of binary stars considered as gravitational two-body systems. The dynamics of a binary star are determined by its primary and secondary stars' masses along with the secondary star's…

items.title: Characterizing Lyman alpha emission from high-redshift galaxies
items.summary: arXiv:2602.13389v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The Lyman $\alpha$ (Ly$\alpha$) line from high-redshift galaxies is a powerful probe of the Epoch of Reionization (EoR). Neutral hydrogen in the intergalactic medium (IGM) can significantly attenuate the emergent Ly$\alpha$ line, ev…
